title: Medieval Monarchs Quiz
description: How well do you recall the kings and rulers of the Middle Ages?

questions.question: Which king signed the Magna Carta in 1215?
questions.explanation: King John of England was forced by rebellious barons to sign the Magna Carta at Runnymede in 1215, limiting royal power.

questions.question: Who was crowned the first Holy Roman Emperor on Christmas Day, 800 AD?
questions.explanation: Charlemagne (Charles the Great) was crowned Emperor by Pope Leo III on December 25, 800 AD, creating the foundation of the Holy Roman Empire.

questions.question: Which English king won the Battle of Agincourt in 1415?
questions.explanation: Henry V led the English to a stunning victory at Agincourt against a much larger French army on October 25, 1415.

questions.question: Who was the Viking king who conquered England in 1066?
questions.explanation: William the Conqueror (William, Duke of Normandy) defeated King Harold II at the Battle of Hastings in 1066 and became King of England.

questions.question: Which English king led the Third Crusade and was known as 'the Lionheart'?
questions.explanation: Richard I, known as Richard the Lionheart, led the Third Crusade (1189-1192) and became a legendary figure of medieval chivalry.

questions.question: Which French king was known as 'Saint Louis' and led two Crusades?
questions.explanation: Louis IX of France was canonized as a saint and led the Seventh and Eighth Crusades. He died during the Eighth Crusade in 1270.

questions.question: Which Holy Roman Emperor was known as 'Barbarossa' (Red Beard)?
questions.explanation: Frederick I Barbarossa was Holy Roman Emperor from 1155 to 1190, known for his attempts to restore the glory of the old Roman Empire.

questions.question: Which Anglo-Saxon king is known for burning the cakes and defeating the Vikings?
questions.explanation: Alfred the Great of Wessex (849-899) is famous both for the legendary story of burning the cakes and for his victories against the Vikings.

questions.question: Which Ottoman Sultan conquered Constantinople in 1453?
questions.explanation: Sultan Mehmed II conquered Constantinople on May 29, 1453, ending the Byzantine Empire and earning the title 'the Conqueror.'

questions.question: Which English king had six wives?
questions.explanation: Henry VIII had six wives: Catherine of Aragon, Anne Boleyn, Jane Seymour, Anne of Cleves, Catherine Howard, and Catherine Parr.

questions.question: Which Scandinavian king united Denmark, Norway, and parts of England?
questions.explanation: Canute the Great (Cnut) ruled over Denmark, England, and Norway, creating a vast North Sea empire in the early 11th century.

questions.question: Which Scottish king defeated the English at the Battle of Bannockburn in 1314?
questions.explanation: Robert the Bruce won a decisive victory at Bannockburn against Edward II's much larger English army, securing Scottish independence.

questions.question: Which king of England was defeated and killed at the Battle of Bosworth Field in 1485?
questions.explanation: Richard III was the last English king to die in battle, killed at Bosworth Field on August 22, 1485. Henry Tudor then became Henry VII.

questions.question: Which Byzantine Emperor codified Roman law into the 'Corpus Juris Civilis'?
questions.explanation: Emperor Justinian I commissioned the codification of Roman law around 529-534 AD, forming the basis of civil law in many modern countries.

questions.question: Which Spanish monarchs completed the Reconquista by capturing Granada in 1492?
questions.explanation: Ferdinand II of Aragon and Isabella I of Castile conquered the last Moorish kingdom of Granada in January 1492, completing the Reconquista.
